Paper 1.stem: P is the point (-3, 1) and Q is the point (3, 3).
Paper 1.diagramDescription: A coordinate grid showing points P at (-3, 1) and Q at (3, 3).

parts.questionText: Find the length of the PQ.
The point R is such that PQR forms an isosceles triangle. The angle bisector of angle PQR has an equation of $y=x$. Find the coordinates of R.

Paper 1.title: Coordinate Geometry

Paper 1.stem: The coordinates of P and Q are (0, 3) and (15, 12) respectively.
Paper 1.diagramDescription: Coordinate axes with points P(0,3) on y-axis and Q(15,12) in first quadrant. Line segment PQ is drawn.

parts.questionText: Find the equation of PQ.
Find the perimeter of trapezium OPQR, where O is the origin and R is the point of reflection of Q along the x-axis.

Paper 1.title: Coordinate Geometry Trapezium

Paper 1.stem: The triangle with vertices A (2, 5), $B(-2,-3)$ and $C(2,-2)$ is shown in the diagram below.
Paper 1.diagramDescription: Triangle ABC drawn on Cartesian plane.

parts.questionText: Find the area of triangle ABC.
Find the coordinates of point D such that ABCD is a parallelogram.
Find the area of parallelogram ABCD.
Find angle BAC.
Find the gradient of line AC.
Find the cosine value of angle BCA in terms of p, where $p=BC.$

Paper 1.title: Coordinate Geometry Triangle

Paper 1.stem: The diagram below shows a triangle ABC, with $A(3,6)$ and $B(-11,0)$. Triangle ABC has an area of $22.5~units^{2}$. E is a point on the line AB passing through the y-axis.
Paper 1.diagramDescription: Triangle ABC on Cartesian plane. A(3,6), B(-11,0), C is on x-axis. E is y-intercept of line AB.

parts.questionText: Find the length AB.
Find the equation of the line AB.
State the coordinates of E.
Find the coordinates of C.
Given that ABDC is a parallelogram, find the coordinates of D.
The line $l$ has equation $7y-3x+15=0$. Explain whether line $l$ will ever cut the line AB when both lines are extended. Show your workings clearly.

Paper 1.title: Coordinate Geometry

Paper 2.stem: A is the point (-3, -1) (inferred) and D is the point (0, 1.5) (inferred). B is a point on the y-axis.
Paper 2.diagramDescription: Quadrilateral ABCD on Cartesian axes. A is in third quadrant, B on negative y-axis, C in first or fourth, D on positive y-axis.

parts.questionText: The line AB is parallel to $3y+5x-6=0$. Find the equation of the line AB.
Find the coordinates of C such that it is equidistant from B and D and it lies on the line $y=7.5-x$.
Find the area of the quadrilateral ABCD.
Find the size of angle ABC.

Paper 2.title: Coordinate Geometry

Paper 2.stem: (a) A is the point (2,3) and B is the point (3,-5).
Paper 2.diagramDescription: Diagram for part b showing parallelogram OABC. Vector OA=2a, Vector OC=3c. T on OB. M on BC.

parts.questionText: Find the equation of the line AB.
Find the length of AB.
$\vec{BC}=\begin{pmatrix}-4\\ 3\end{pmatrix}.$ Find the coordinates of point C.
OABC is a parallelogram. $\vec{OA}=2a$ and $\vec{OC}=3c$. M is the midpoint of BC. T is the point on OB such that OT: $TB=2:1$. Find $\vec{OB}$ in terms of a and c.
Find $\vec{OT}$ in terms of a and c.
Determine if the points A, T and M lie on a straight line.

Paper 2.title: Coordinate Geometry and Vectors
